461: At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day. Nutrien Ag Solutions is the retail division of Nutrien™, the largest crop inputs company in the world. As part of our collective mission of Feeding the Future, Nutrien Ag Solutions provides full-acre solutions through our trusted crop consultants at more than 2,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Australia. For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven®Seed and Dyna-Gro®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services. We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion. Working at Nutrien Ag Solutions will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be, and grow your career. What you will do: Draft formal project proposals which are peer reviewed by internal colleagues Write clear and detailed experimental protocols Be fully responsible for hands-on research in the laboratory and greenhouse. Work side by side with shared technicians in our labs on site. Write protocols, implement research, analyze data, draw and share conclusions, and evaluate project success vs. project goals. All research is documented in formal reports Propose and modify existing soil and crop science SOPs for use in our lab Drive innovative solutions Stay current with relevant professional / scientific societies. Read and share journal articles with colleagues Use applied statistics software for data analysis Assume responsibility for certain analytical instruments and lab areas. Assigned areas will be exemplary in terms of safety and compliance Take ownership for continuous improvement in the safety culture of self and colleagues Be a leader and example of the company’s Culture of Care What you will bring: M.Sc. required, preferably in Soil Science, or a related field; experience may be considered in lieu education. Ph.D in the above discipline preferred Minimum of 2 years of related experience in agricultural research relating to crop nutrition, plant protection, soil science, crop production or biostimulants required. Additional experience preferred Self-motivation, assertiveness, initiative, and results orientation Proficiency in technical writing and presentations Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and computer skills Excellent project planning and organizational skills Ability to build strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders in which you effectively listen well to others, and accept and provide constructive feedback, suggestions, and recognition as appropriate Ability to think creatively and solve problems Demonstrated ability to work independently and drive results Compensation & Benefits: The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
